page.title: 05Merry Orchard Mushroom Farm
page.content: The farm belongs to Mr.Sum who has about 30 people working for him.9 of them work full time-40 hrs.per week.They start at 7.00 a.m.& stop when all their work is finished.They sell cup & open mushrooms & a special quality for caterers.Prices start at 65p.per pound for,"rejects," & rise to 80p.for cups.Spawns are sprinkled on pasteurised horse manure & in a few days a layer of chalk & peat is added. Mushrooms grow through this layer. There are 12 sheds & it takes 12 days for the whole process.They are picked over 3 days. Each shed has 78 "beds", 6ft. by 4ft., which are stacked about 8 feet high, & there are 20 tons of compost per shed. Compost can only be used once so it is then sold. The farm was established in 1948. Mr. and Mrs. Sum have owned it for 4 years.(Written following a visit by a group of girls)
